availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allen L. McAfee (Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier - Mjr. 6th Ky. Cav. (C.S.A.))

body.p: Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Rice McAfee. Father of Archibald McAfee, Catherine McAfee, Robert McAfee, George McAfee, Lawson McAfee, and John McAfee. Farmer in Jessamine County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1850. Merchant in Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, n 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholasville in 1860. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a major. Taken prisoner of war in Jessamine County on June 14, 1864. Paroled on June 20, 1865.
